channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: Google-Intel Security Audit Reveals Severe TDX Vulnerability Allowing Full Compromise
item.description: Dozens of vulnerabilities, bugs, and potential improvements have been identified by the tech giants’ security teams. The post Google-Intel Security Audit Reveals Severe TDX Vulnerability Allowing Full Compromise appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Elevated errors on Opus 4.6
item.description: Feb 11, 08:37 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved.Feb 11, 08:31 UTCMonitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.Feb 11, 08:21 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: ICS Patch Tuesday: Vulnerabilities Addressed by Siemens, Schneider, Aveva, Phoenix Contact
item.description: Several vulnerabilities have been patched and mitigated across the industrial giants’ products. The post ICS Patch Tuesday: Vulnerabilities Addressed by Siemens, Schneider, Aveva, Phoenix Contact appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: XPeng Aridge’s “Land Aircraft Carrier” Flying Car Passes –35°C Extreme Tests, Set for 2026 Rollout
item.description: XPeng Aridge’s “Land Aircraft Carrier” flying car passed –35°C extreme cold tests with stable ground and flight performance ahead of its 2026 rollout.

item.title: Dexmal Unveils DM0, the World’s First Embodied-Native Foundation Model
item.description: Dexmal unveiled DM0, the world’s first embodied-native foundation model, whose 2.4B version tops RoboChallenge rankings and is now fully open-sourced.

item.title: Ant Group Open-Sources Full-Modality Model Ming-Flash-Omni 2.0
item.description: Ant Group has open-sourced Ming-Flash-Omni 2.0, a unified multimodal model capable of generating speech, music, and sound effects in a single track with fine-grained natural language control.

item.title: ENGINEAI Launches World’s First Commercial Humanoid Robot Fighting League
item.description: ENGINEAI has launched the world’s first commercial humanoid robot fighting league, offering up to USD 1.4 million in prizes to accelerate embodied AI development through real combat.

item.title: North Korea-Linked UNC1069 Uses AI Lures to Attack Cryptocurrency Organizations
item.description: The North Korea-linked threat actor known as UNC1069 has been observed targeting the cryptocurrency sector to steal sensitive data from Windows and macOS systems with the ultimate goal of facilitating financial theft. "The intrusion relied on a social engineering scheme involving a compromised...

item.title: SenseTime-Backed ACE Robotics Raises Angel Round Led by Ant Group
item.description: SenseTime-backed ACE Robotics has raised an angel round led by Ant Group to scale its embodied AI “super brain” and Kairos 3.0 world model for industrial deployment.

item.title: [AINews] Qwen Image 2 and Seedance 2
item.description: Strong generative media showings from China

item.title: A Small-Scale System for Autoregressive Program Synthesis Enabling Controlled Experimentation
item.description: arXiv:2602.09112v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: What research can be pursued with small models trained to complete true programs? Typically, researchers study program synthesis via large language models (LLMs) which introduce issues such as knowing what is in or out of distribution, understanding...

item.title: Uncertainty-Aware Multimodal Emotion Recognition through Dirichlet Parameterization
item.description: arXiv:2602.09121v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this work, we present a lightweight and privacy-preserving Multimodal Emotion Recognition (MER) framework designed for deployment on edge devices. To demonstrate framework's versatility, our implementation uses three modalities - speech, text and...

item.title: PABU: Progress-Aware Belief Update for Efficient LLM Agents
item.description: arXiv:2602.09138v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Model (LLM) agents commonly condition actions on full action-observation histories, which introduce task-irrelevant information that easily leads to redundant actions and higher inference cost. We propose Progress-Aware Belief Update...

item.title: CoMMa: Contribution-Aware Medical Multi-Agents From A Game-Theoretic Perspective
item.description: arXiv:2602.09159v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent multi-agent frameworks have broadened the ability to tackle oncology decision support tasks that require reasoning over dynamic, heterogeneous patient data. We propose Contribution-Aware Medical Multi-Agents (CoMMa), a decentralized LLM-agent...

item.title: FlyAOC: Evaluating Agentic Ontology Curation of Drosophila Scientific Knowledge Bases
item.description: arXiv:2602.09163v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Scientific knowledge bases accelerate discovery by curating findings from primary literature into structured, queryable formats for both human researchers and emerging AI systems. Maintaining these resources requires expert curators to search relevant...

item.title: Enhanced Graph Transformer with Serialized Graph Tokens
item.description: arXiv:2602.09065v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Transformers have demonstrated success in graph learning, particularly for node-level tasks. However, existing methods encounter an information bottleneck when generating graph-level representations. The prevalent single token paradigm fails to fully...

item.title: Spectral Disentanglement and Enhancement: A Dual-domain Contrastive Framework for Representation Learning
item.description: arXiv:2602.09066v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large-scale multimodal contrastive learning has recently achieved impressive success in learning rich and transferable representations, yet it remains fundamentally limited by the uniform treatment of feature dimensions and the neglect of the...

item.title: Learning to Remember, Learn, and Forget in Attention-Based Models
item.description: arXiv:2602.09075v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In-Context Learning (ICL) in transformers acts as an online associative memory and is believed to underpin their high performance on complex sequence processing tasks. However, in gated linear attention models, this memory has a fixed capacity and is...

item.title: Patient foundation model for risk stratification in low-risk overweight patients
item.description: arXiv:2602.09079v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Accurate risk stratification in patients with overweight or obesity is critical for guiding preventive care and allocating high-cost therapies such as GLP-1 receptor agonists. We present PatientTPP, a neural temporal point process (TPP) model trained...

item.title: Looping Back to Move Forward: Recursive Transformers for Efficient and Flexible Large Multimodal Models
item.description: arXiv:2602.09080v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) have achieved remarkable success in vision-language tasks, yet their vast parameter counts are often underutilized during both training and inference. In this work, we embrace the idea of looping back to move forward:...

item.title: Overview of PAN 2026: Voight-Kampff Generative AI Detection, Text Watermarking, Multi-Author Writing Style Analysis, Generative Plagiarism Detection, and Reasoning Trajectory Detection
item.description: arXiv:2602.09147v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The goal of the PAN workshop is to advance computational stylometry and text forensics via objective and reproducible evaluation. In 2026, we run the following five tasks: (1) Voight-Kampff Generative AI Detection, particularly in mixed and obfuscated...

item.title: Measuring Inclusion in Interaction: Inclusion Analytics for Human-AI Collaborative Learning
item.description: arXiv:2602.09269v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Inclusion, equity, and access are widely valued in AI and education, yet are often assessed through coarse sample descriptors or post-hoc self-reports that miss how inclusion is shaped moment by moment in collaborative problem solving (CPS). In this...

item.title: Effective Reasoning Chains Reduce Intrinsic Dimensionality
item.description: arXiv:2602.09276v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning and its variants have substantially improved the performance of language models on complex reasoning tasks, yet the precise mechanisms by which different strategies facilitate generalization remain poorly understood....

item.title: Don't Shoot The Breeze: Topic Continuity Model Using Nonlinear Naive Bayes With Attention
item.description: arXiv:2602.09312v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Utilizing Large Language Models (LLM) as chatbots in diverse business scenarios often presents the challenge of maintaining topic continuity. Abrupt shifts in topics can lead to poor user experiences and inefficient utilization of computational...

item.title: Beyond Uniform Credit: Causal Credit Assignment for Policy Optimization
item.description: arXiv:2602.09331v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Policy gradient methods for language model reasoning, such as GRPO and DAPO, assign uniform credit to all generated tokens - the filler phrase "Let me think" receives the same gradient update as the critical calculation "23 + 45 = 68." We propose...

item.description: Status: ResolvedAll impacted services have now fully recovered.Affected components Login (Operational)

item.description: Feb 10, 22:11 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating the issue.

item.title: Patch Tuesday, February 2026 Edition
item.description: Microsoft today released updates to fix more than 50 security holes in its Windows operating systems and other software, including patches for a whopping six "zero-day" vulnerabilities that attackers are already exploiting in the wild.

item.title: Increased error rates for ChatGPT Go
item.description: Status: MonitoringMitigation has been successfully implemented and error rates have returned to normal levels. We are continuing to monitor the system to ensure sustained stability.Affected components Conversations (Degraded performance)

item.title: 6 Actively Exploited Zero-Days Patched by Microsoft With February 2026 Updates
item.description: Microsoft’s Patch Tuesday updates fix roughly 60 vulnerabilities found in the company’s products. The post 6 Actively Exploited Zero-Days Patched by Microsoft With February 2026 Updates appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: EU Unconditionally Approves Google’s $32B Acquisition of Wiz
item.description: The European Commission’s ruling is based on extensive feedback from customers and rival cloud security and infrastructure vendors. The post EU Unconditionally Approves Google’s $32B Acquisition of Wiz appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: DPRK Operatives Impersonate Professionals on LinkedIn to Infiltrate Companies
item.description: The information technology (IT) workers associated with the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) are now applying to remote positions using real LinkedIn accounts of individuals they're impersonating, marking a new escalation of the fraudulent scheme. "These profiles often have verified...

item.title: Patch Tuesday: Adobe Fixes 44 Vulnerabilities in Creative Apps
item.description: The company has fixed several critical vulnerabilities that can be exploited for arbitrary code execution. The post Patch Tuesday: Adobe Fixes 44 Vulnerabilities in Creative Apps appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: A “QuitGPT” campaign is urging people to cancel their ChatGPT subscriptions
item.description: In September, Alfred Stephen, a freelance software developer in Singapore, purchased a ChatGPT Plus subscription, which costs $20 a month and offers more access to advanced models, to speed up his work. But he grew frustrated with the chatbot’s coding abilities and its gushing, meandering replies....

item.title: The Scientist and the Simulator
item.description: LLMs (alone) won’t cure cancer

item.title: Reynolds Ransomware Embeds BYOVD Driver to Disable EDR Security Tools
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of an emergent ransomware family dubbed Reynolds that comes embedded with a built-in bring your own vulnerable driver (BYOVD) component for defense evasion purposes within the ransomware payload itself. BYOVD refers to an adversarial technique that...

item.title: From Ransomware to Residency: Inside the Rise of the Digital Parasite
item.description: Are ransomware and encryption still the defining signals of modern cyberattacks, or has the industry been too fixated on noise while missing a more dangerous shift happening quietly all around them? According to Picus Labs’ new Red Report 2026, which analyzed over 1.1 million malicious files and...

item.title: The Download: Making AI Work, and why the Moltbook hype is similar to Pokémon
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. A first look at Making AI Work, MIT Technology Review’s new AI newsletter Are you interested in learning more about the ways in which AI is actually...

item.title: Stroke3D: Lifting 2D strokes into rigged 3D model via latent diffusion models
item.description: Rigged 3D assets are fundamental to 3D deformation and animation. However, existing 3D generation methods face challenges in generating animatable geometry, while rigging techniques lack fine-grained structural control over skeleton creation. To address these limitations, we introduce Stroke3D, a...

item.title: TraceMem: Weaving Narrative Memory Schemata from User Conversational Traces
item.description: Sustaining long-term interactions remains a bottleneck for Large Language Models (LLMs), as their limited context windows struggle to manage dialogue histories that extend over time. Existing memory systems often treat interactions as disjointed snippets, failing to capture the underlying narrative...

item.title: ZAST.AI Raises $6M Pre-A to Scale "Zero False Positive" AI-Powered Code Security
item.description: January 5, 2026, Seattle, USA — ZAST.AI announced the completion of a $6 million Pre-A funding round. This investment came from the well-known investment firm Hillhouse Capital, bringing ZAST.AI's total funding close to $10 million. This marks a recognition from leading capital markets of a new...

item.title: Opus 4.6 Fast Mode small amount of errors
item.description: Feb 10, 11:23 UTCInvestigating - Starting at about 02:05 PST Opus 4.6 Fast Mode serves a small amount of errors. We are investigating.

item.title: From Average Sensitivity to Small-Loss Regret Bounds under Random-Order Model
item.description: We study online learning in the random-order model, where the multiset of loss functions is chosen adversarially but revealed in a uniformly random order. Building on the batch-to-online conversion by Dong and Yoshida (2023), we show that if an offline algorithm admits a...

item.title: Beyond Input-Output: Rethinking Creativity through Design-by-Analogy in Human-AI Collaboration
item.description: While the proliferation of foundation models has significantly boosted individual productivity, it also introduces a potential challenge: the homogenization of creative content. In response, we revisit Design-by-Analogy (DbA), a cognitively grounded approach that fosters novel solutions by mapping...

item.title: [AINews] "Sci-Fi with a touch of Madness"
item.description: a quiet day lets us reflect on a pithy quote from the ClawFather.

item.title: A Deep Multi-Modal Method for Patient Wound Healing Assessment
item.description: Hospitalization of patients is one of the major factors for high wound care costs. Most patients do not acquire a wound which needs immediate hospitalization. However, due to factors such as delay in treatment, patient's non-compliance or existing co-morbid conditions, an injury can deteriorate and...

item.title: Copilot Policy Propagation Delays
item.description: Feb 9, 20:39 UTCUpdate - We're continuing to investigate an issue where Copilot policy updates are not propagating correctly for a subset of enterprise users.This may prevent newly enabled models from appearing when users try to access them.Next update in two hours.Feb 9, 18:49 UTCUpdate - We're...

item.title: Improving your response to vulnerability management
item.description: How to ensure the ‘organisational memory’ of past vulnerabilities is not lost.
